treatment.description: Inflorescences dense, 10–35(–62) × 1–3(–4) cm, internodes in floral branchlets 0.3–1 mm. Pedicels 0.2–0.9 mm. Flowers: hypanthium subglobose, gla-brous or sparsely long stipitate-glandular; petals reflexed or tightly coiled, narrowly oblanceolate, 0.2–0.4 mm wide. 2n = 14.
treatment.habitat: Shaded rocks and ledges, granite, gneiss, or acidic humus over limestone or shallow rocky soil
treatment.discussion: Variety arkansana is found in the Ozark Mountains.
